name: MP Materials
description: Deal announced in order to expand the only operating rare earth element mine in the U.S. and to enhance their mineral processing and permanent magent manufacturing capacity.
structure: Guaranteed price of $110/kg for 10 years (current market: ~$60/kg), with 30% profit sharing above $110. DoD commits to purchasing all NdFEB magnets for 10 years at cost plus $140M annually. $400M 15% equity stake through convertible stock and warrants. $150M loan to expand the Mountain Pass processing facility.
notes: White House Advisor Stephen Miller sold shares in MP materials days after the government announced their investment. Source: [{"Source" :"NYT", "url": https://www.nytimes.com/2025/12/09/us/politics/stephen-miller-minerals-stake-ethics.html"}]
area: Critical Minerals, Rare Earths, Neodymium, Praseodymium

name: Intel
description: Deal intended to bolster secure American semiconductor manufacturing by taking a 9.9% stake in Intel.
structure: $5.7 billion from remaining CHIPS Act grants plus $3.2 billion from Secure Enclave program for a 9.9% stake in Intel.

name: US Steel / Nippon Steel
description: Golden share' giving the federal government veto power over key corporate decisions as part of the Nippon Steel acquisition approval

name: Lithium Americas Corporation
description: Restructuring of an existing loan into an equity stake in LAC and in their Thacker Pass project in order to ensure a secure domestic supply of lithium for EV battery production.
structure: $182 million in deferred debt payments over 5 years in exchange for 5% equity stake in Lithium Americas and additional 5% stake in Thacker Pass JV with GM

notes.text: Third highest official at the Department of Interior has direct conflict of interest from family investments in water rights near Thacker Pass.

name: Trilogy Metals Inc.
description: Equity investment for exploration in Alaska's Ambler District and financing the Ambler Access Road to unlock potentiao copper and cobalt deposits.
structure: 10% stake for $35.6 million investment, plus warrants for an additional 7.5%
notes: Major Trump political donor John Paulson owned an 8.7% stake in Trilogy Metals as of the end of June.

name: Vulcan Elements / ReElement Technologies
description: Financing a vertically integrated rare earth magnet supply chain. $700 million in loans and $50 million in CHIPS Act funding in exchange for warrants in both companies and $50 million of equity in Vulcan Elements.
structure: $620 million direct loan from the Department of War's Office of Strategic Capital to Vulcan Elements. $50 million in federal incentives from the Department of Commerce under the CHIPS and Science Act to Vulcan Elements. $80 million direct loan from the Office of Strategic Capital to ReElement Technologies, matched by private capital. $550 million in private capital for Vulcan Elements. Department of Defense receives warrants in both Vulcan Elements and ReElement Technologies. Department of Commerce receives $50 million of equity in Vulcan Elements.

name: Korea Zinc
description: Establishment of a joint venture between the DoD and unnamed investors to establish a zinc smelter inTennesse. 10% total stake in Korea Zinc.
structure: $1.9B of shares sold to a joint venture with 40% Department of Defense ownership and 60% unnamed investors yielding a 10% total stake in Korea Zinc

name: Atlantic Alumina
description: $150M of preferred equity in ATALCO inteded to sustain and expand domestic alumina production and establish the first primary gallium production capability in Gramercy, Louisiana.
structure: $150M of preferred equity in ATALCO by the Department of Defense's Industrial Base Analysis and Sustainment program. Pinnacle Asset Management and Concord Resources to provide $300M in private capital. Additional government capital expected

name: Westinghouse
description: $80B partnership announced to help construct new nuclear plants. The U.S. government gets a percentage of Westinghouse profits and the option to purchase equity at a later date.
structure: The U.S. government gets 20% of Westinghouse profits above $17.5 billion, plus the option to require an IPO and purchase a 20% equity stake if the company is valued at $30 billion or more by January 2029.

name: xLight
description: $150M in CHIPS Act funding to research and develop free-electron laser tools for advanced lithography and semiconductor manufacturing.
structure: Letter of intent signed that gives xLight $150M of CHIPS Act funding in exchange for an undisclosed equity stake
